result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony S Sturino was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Sexual Assault], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To be paid w/n the first 18 months of probation.

If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
****Court in unenthusiastic about DOC placing DE in OADA treatment, though it is not prohibited.
****DOC is prohibited from putting DE on sex offender status w/o court evaluation and approval.
****DOC may not restrict contact w/ DE and his child other than in emergency circumstances w/o court permission.
*   Pay fine of $500 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.  To be paid w/n first 18 months of probation.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
DOC shall promptly notify the court, in writing, of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

superMiscConds.notes: ES conditions to be identical to those of probation unless already satisfied.  Court costs are paid in full.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony S Sturino

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Zach Brost appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Carl Johnson.  Agent present.  Brief discussion held.  Court will eliminate the restraint on DOC employing use of sex offender status.
Review hearing on March 2, 2020 at 01:15 pm.
Per Court, set hrg re: agent's letter.
from Agent Nicole Drzadinski re: sex offender status
6yrs WSP; initial confinement of 2yrs followed by 4yrs of ES.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA James Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Carl Johnson.  Victim rights compliance.  Victim present; statement made.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 6yrs WSP; initial confinement of 2yrs followed by 4yrs of ES.  ES conditions to be identical to those of probation unless already satisfied.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP.  Credit for 73 days.  Appeal rights.  Voting acknowledgment.
Atty Carl Johnson

Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

State appears by ADA James Kraus. DE appears in person with Atty Carl Johnson for Atty Angela Komp. Victim, Amy S., present.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  128 - Victim rights compliance. All parties have reviewed PSI.  Victim statement. Sentence recommendations made. Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 2 years w/conditions. ** DOC is prohibited from putting DE on sex offender status without court evaluation and approval.  Court is also unenthusiastic about DOC placing DE in AODA treatment, though it is not prohibited. DOC may not restrict contact with DE and his child other than in emergency circumstances without court permission. Court orders a $500 fine plus costs, due over the first 18 months of probation. Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Firearms warning, Voters rights, Appeal rights given.
Sentencing hearing on May 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
email between Tami & ADA Kraus

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Komp.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Deft pleads guilty; found guilty by the Court.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 5/13/16 @ 11am
